summary: This document is a sealed application and supporting affidavit from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, filed on June 29, 2020, seeking warrants and orders for prospective and historical cellphone location data and pen register information for two cellphones believed to be used by Ghislaine Maxwell. The application is made in support of an ongoing criminal investigation and a recently unsealed indictment against Maxwell, with the goal of locating and arresting her.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signs the application as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, requesting the court issue warrants for cellphone location and pen register information.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Listed as an Assistant U.S. Attorney of counsel on the application for the warrants.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The primary target of the investigation. The affidavit states she is believed to use the target cellphones and was indicted on June 29, 2020, for conspiracy, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The goal of the warrants is to locate her for arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a close associate and employer of Ghislaine Maxwell. His arrest in July 2019 and the subsequent search of his phone, which contained a contact for one of Maxwell's alleged phones, is cited as part of the investigation.

persons.name: Joshua Perry
persons.context: Husband of a former Epstein employee. His phone number was in contact with one of the target cellphones (Target Cellphone-1) as recently as May 2020.

persons.name: Isabel Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister. Her phone was in contact with both target cellphones, with the last contact noted in August 2019.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation. Her phone was in contact with both target cellphones, with the last contact noted in August 2019.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: An individual with whom Ghislaine Maxwell shares a joint bank account and to whom her Amazon account has sent packages. His phone was in contact with both target cellphones, with the last contact noted in August 2019.

persons.name: Lisa Margaret Smith
persons.context: Signed the arrest warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020, which is referenced as Exhibit B in the affidavit.

persons.name: Catharine H. Parker
persons.context: The magistrate judge before whom the FBI agent's affidavit was sworn and who issued the final warrants and orders for the cellphone data.

persons.name: Amanda Young
persons.context: The affiant, a Special Agent with the FBI who submitted the detailed affidavit in support of the warrants for cellphone location and pen register information.

connections.description: Described as a 'close associate and employee.' Maxwell is charged with committing the subject offenses together with Epstein.
Isabel Maxwell is identified as Ghislaine Maxwell's sister, and their phones were in contact.
Laura Menninger is an attorney who represents Ghislaine Maxwell in civil litigation, and their phones were in contact.
They share a joint bank account, and Maxwell's Amazon account has sent multiple packages to Borgerson.
Perry is the husband of a former Epstein employee, and his phone was in contact with a phone believed to be used by Maxwell.

events.title: Indictment and Arrest Warrant for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. Magistrate Judge Lisa Margaret Smith signed a warrant for her arrest the same day.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI on federal sex trafficking charges. An iPhone was seized from him during the arrest.

events.title: Application for Cellphone Tracking Warrants
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office filed a sealed application and affidavit seeking warrants for prospective/historical location data and pen registers for two phones linked to Ghislaine Maxwell to locate her for arrest.

keyFacts: On June 29, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted and an arrest warrant was issued for her, but the indictment and warrant were not publicly known at the time of this application.
The FBI sought to track two cellphones: one subscribed to 'Terramar Project, Inc.' (T-Mobile) and another to 'G Max' (AT&T), both believed to be used by Maxwell.

Evidence linking Maxwell to the phones includes: a contact for one phone saved as 'Ghislaine' in Jeffrey Epstein's seized iPhone, and recent contacts from the phones to her sister, attorneys, and an associate (Scott Borgerson).

The application requests a non-disclosure order to prevent the cell service providers from notifying the subscriber (Maxwell) for one year, citing risks of flight, witness intimidation, and evidence destruction.
The warrants sought 45 days of prospective location/pen register data and historical data from June 1, 2020, onward to locate Maxwell for arrest.
